error.signature: Error: Starting inspector on 127.0.0.1:9229 failed: address already in use

verdict.summary: The Node.js inspector (debugger) port 9229 is already in use by another Node.js process or a previous debug session that was not properly terminated.

dead_ends.action: Running multiple --inspect processes without specifying different ports
dead_ends.why_fails: All default to port 9229; only the first one succeeds, the rest fail with this error

dead_ends.action: Killing all Node.js processes to free the port
dead_ends.why_fails: Kills production processes along with debug ones; overly destructive approach

workarounds.how: node --inspect=127.0.0.1:9230 app.js â€” each debug session should use a unique port

workarounds.action: Find and kill the process using port 9229
workarounds.how: lsof -i :9229 to find the PID, then kill <PID>
workarounds.condition: when only one debug session is needed

leads_to.condition: when the port conflict pattern extends to application ports

preceded_by.condition: when developers start debugging port-in-use issues

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Inspector already active is specifically about the debug port 9229, while EADDRINUSE can happen on any port the application tries to bind
